snippet: The guilty verdict for more than three dozen employees, among them many Americans, came in a trial the United States has called politically motivated.
abstract: Egyptian criminal court finds more than three dozen employees of foreign nonprofit groups, including 16 Americans, guilty of receiving illegal funds from abroad and operating unlicensed organizations; verdicts underline Egyptian leaders' persistent fear of foreign meddling; United States calls convictions politically motivated.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington, and Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The guilty verdict for more than three dozen employees, among them many Americans, came in a trial the United States has called politically motivated.

headline.seo: In Egypt, Foreign Nonprofit Workers Convicted
headline.main: Egypt Convicts Workers at Foreign Nonprofit Groups, Including 16 Americans
headline.print_headline: Egypt Convicts Workers at Foreign Nonprofit Groups, Including 16 Americans
